name: in the garden - for immortal memory
description:
Place as a refuge.  Space as a belief.  These photographs are the result of a search for the places of myth.  The inspiration for the story came from the everyday witness and observations of people all around.  The gardens and the groves and the orchards and the caves were the result of a belief in the sanctity of place.  These images look at the everyday and assign a belief in the story they can provide.  This exhibit looks at the stories which surround space and place and gives a small window into what the imagination can perceive as real. 
 
32 x 32
